discussion.p: In the shiny new world of the future, we need not declare overloads of operator!= that return !(x == y); the rewrite rule in para 3.4.3 achieves the same effect. Consequently, we should not declare such unnecessary operator!= overloads. The synopsis of class stop_token in declares exactly such an operator!= friend which should be struck.
discussion.note: 01-2020 Moved to Tentatively Ready after 5 positive votes on the reflector.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4830.

li.p: Modify , class stop_token synopsis, as indicated:

blockquote.pre: [[nodiscard]] bool operator==(const stop_token& lhs, const stop_token& rhs) noexcept;

blockquote.p: -1- Returns: true if lhs and rhs have ownership of the same stop state or if both lhs and rhs do not have ownership of a stop state; otherwise false.

pre.del: [[nodiscard]] bool operator!=(const stop_token& lhs, const stop_token& rhs) noexcept;
